alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 22 at 4:21AM PST until February 26 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 18 inches possible for southern and western portions of Mineral County in addition to southern Lyon County. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches possible elsewhere. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, including the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty southeast winds will cause considerable blowing and drifting of snow. Travel along US-95 could be greatly impacted, especially for areas from Hawthorne south.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
